title: 112_hr4373
content: The Act titled "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" provides expanded tax benefits for adoption that are made permanent. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" made expansions enacted in 2001 permanent and expansions enacted in 2010 permanently reinstated, including an increase in the dollar limitation for adoption credits. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" increased the adoption credit from $10,000 to $13,170 for children with special needs. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" raised the adoption credit from $10,000 to $13,170 for children with special needs, with adjustments for inflation. The dollar amount for the adoption credit is adjusted for inflation annually, rounded to the nearest multiple of $10, and increased for children with special needs. The dollar amount for the adoption credit is adjusted annually for inflation beginning after December 31, 2002, based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The adoption credit dollar amount is adjusted annually for inflation, rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The dollar limitation is increased to $13,170 for adoption assistance programs. The adoption credit dollar amount is adjusted annually for inflation, with the dollar limitation increased to $13,170 for adoption assistance programs. Subsection (f) of section 137 of the Code is amended for inflation adjustments. The dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) are adjusted for inflation annually, with adjustments based on the cost-of-living determined for the calendar year. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) are adjusted for inflation annually based on the cost-of-living for the calendar year. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The cost-of-living adjustment for the taxable year is determined based on the calendar year 2001 instead of 1992. Any increased amount not a multiple of $10 will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The credit is made refundable by moving it to a subpart relating to refundable credits in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to redesignate section 23 as section 36C and move it to a new location before section 37. Conforming amendments are made to other sections of the Code. Section 24(b)(3)(B), 25(e)(1)(C), 25A(i)(5)(B), 25B(g)(2), 26(a)(1), 30(c)(2)(B)(ii), and 30B(g)(2)(B)(ii) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are all amended by striking references to section 23. Section 26(a)(1), 30(c)(2)(B)(ii), 30B(g)(2)(B)(ii), and 30D(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are all amended by removing references to section 23. Section 36C is also amended by removing subsection (c) and paragraph (4) of subsection (b). Section 137 is also amended. Section 36C of the Internal Revenue Code is amended by removing subsection (c) and paragraph (4) of subsection (b). Section 137 is also amended by updating references to section 23 with section 36C. Section 904(i) is amended by removing reference to section 23. Section 1016(a)(26) is also amended. Section 36C of the Internal Revenue Code is amended by updating references from section 23 to section 36C in various subsections and sections. Section 36C of the Internal Revenue Code is amended by updating references in various subsections and sections. Section 36C of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to update references in subsections and sections related to adoption expenses. The amendments made in this subsection will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2011.
